lg.l: Where the woods and waters Waters. Possibly a reference to the Whanganui river, the most significant river in the region where Montgomery is known to have lived. meet,
Last night we stood together;
Through the air came, low and sweet,
Soft murmurings from the river.
Each twinkling star on Heaven’s blue breast,
Smiled on my Allan’s love confest!
While the river sang softy to me,
While the river sang softy to me,
Give your smiles to him, give your tears to me,
And I’ll carry them down
To the salt salt sea.
O! quickly sped the entranced hours,
All, all unwatched they passed us by:

The honeysuckle’s Honeysuckle. Possibly a reference to Rewarewa, the “New Zealand honeysuckle,” a tall tree that was common throughout the North Island and bears sweet-smelling red flowers. floating showers
Of balmy fragrance drifted nigh:
Nor brighter shone those orbs above
Than those two human stars I love.
While the river sang softy to me,
While the river sang softy to me,
Give your smiles to him, give your tears to me,
And I’ll carry them down
To the salt salt sea.
Bright beamed each golden eye above,
When on my happy, happy hand,
With many a tender word of love,
My Allan placed a sacred band;
Saying, “Within this circling gold
My love, my hope, my life you hold.”
While the river sang softy to me,
While the river sang softy to me,
Give your smiles to him, give your tears to me,
And I’ll carry them down
To the salt salt sea.
